meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel surprised or upset.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise shocked the cat.
meanings.sent2: She was shocked to see her old friend at the party.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog shocked everyone at the talent show.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in weather shocked the plants into blooming early.
meanings.sent5: The magician's disappearing act left the audience shocked and amazed.

meanings.sent1: He had a shocked expression on his face.
meanings.sent2: The news of the accident left her feeling shocked.
meanings.sent3: The cat's reaction to the vacuum cleaner was quite shocked.
meanings.sent4: The price of the item was so high that it left customers shocked.
meanings.sent5: The ending of the movie was so unexpected that it left the audience shocked.
